title: How good is Aurelion Sol?
body:
Ay all, just been watching a few guides on how to play Aurelion, (have no idea whether its a boy or a girl, for the  sake of this post im calling it him, and yes that is gender assuming ;)) 
So yeah he looks like a relatively nice champ to play in the top or mid lane and i kinda want to pick him up, for a change of pace in my champ pool.
Basically im asking for some tips on how i should be building him, should i take an aggressive or defensive stance in lane, and is he worth buying for 6300 ip?

replies.body:
One of my favourite champions :) 
Hard to fall behind as it stays quite relevant throughout the game. His early game is however somewhat critical to avoid a slow start:
* save mana (dont spam w or ask your jg to give you an early blue)
* farm while moving around and let your passive do the work
* if you're playing against someone that can jump at you easily (see {{champion:84}} {{champion:39}} ) play safer

After 6, your ult is crucial and you have to be quite intelligent on how you're using it. I generally let {{champion:238}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:157}} jump on me, then shout them towards my turret. the panic in their faces is a precious thing. If you are ahead, ganking is basically you second highest priority.

Late game pushing and teamfights are a piece of cake, just be mindful of when using the ult, as it is ur only close range defence, if you get caught out (and you should aim not to be) or your "slow all the enemy team and push them away from the carry" move.

Without the first couple of core items {{item:3027}} {{item:3116}} (or {{item:3030}} ) and {{item:3009}} he feels a bit odd, but once you have these you'll inevitably contribute and split push like a udyr.

I prefer thunderlords' just because it helps with those problems early game mentioned above. But again, play smart and you'll be fine.

Good luck!!

p.s.: his voice actor is soooo great, it should be the top reason to play him

I think A-Sol is a very good champion once you get a few games under your belt. I'm unsure how bad the recent round of nerfs hit him but the base of his kit is still there, which is the ability to hard push almost all match ups and then get his roam on. creating picks around the map and assisting your jungler is what you should focus on more so then 1v1 your lane opponent. Most often you will be running movespeed quints and taking stormraiders surge. And your core build is almost always {{item:3009}} {{item:3030}} {{item:3116}}{{item:3151}}   after that if you need a defensive item  {{item:3102}}  is great as the spell shield stops your w passive from turning off if you take cc or of course {{item:3157}} against AD champs like Zed.
